Circuit Nodes

Modular Electronics Building Blocks

Chapters
Home 1. Introduction 2. Getting Started 3. Printable Bases 4. Assembly Instructions 5. Component Guide 6. Sourcing & Manufacturing

Circuit Nodes is a CC-licensed educational tool designed to help students understand electronic circuits by physically building them. Each module consists of a small PCB mounted on a 3D-printed base with puzzle-like notches, allowing users to create circuits in a grid-based structure.

The pedagogical value lies in reinforcing the connection between abstract circuit diagrams and tangible, working implementations, making theoretical concepts easier to grasp through hands-on experimentation.

Get Started

Explore the chapters using the links below:

  • Introduction – Overview and design principles
  • Getting Started – Quick start guide
  • Printable Bases – Base styles and printing
  • Assembly Instructions – Build your components
  • Component Guide – Full component catalogue
  • Sourcing & Manufacturing – Production and educational research

Features

  • Modular Design: 40x40mm PCBs mounted on 3D-printed bases with interlocking puzzle-like edges
  • Hands-on Learning: Users assemble working circuits based on schematic diagrams
  • Magnetic Connectors: Ensure secure physical and electrical connections
  • Visual Representation: Each PCB features the corresponding circuit schematic
  • Expandable: Additional modules can be designed and added
  • Low Cost & Scalable: An affordable introduction to electronics
